meanings.definition: Making or serving as an announcement.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's annunciatory tone caught the students' attention.
meanings.sent2: The announcer's voice had an annunciatory quality that made everyone listen.
meanings.sent3: The cat's annunciatory meow signaled it was time for dinner.
meanings.sent4: The bright red color of the stop sign was annunciatory of danger ahead.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell was so annunciatory that it could be heard throughout the school.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the act of announcing.
meanings.sent1: Her annunciatory gestures indicated the start of the performance.
meanings.sent2: The banners hanging outside the store had an annunciatory message.
meanings.sent3: The dog's barking was so annunciatory that it woke up the whole neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: The bright lights of the city were annunciatory of a bustling nightlife.
meanings.sent5: The sudden silence in the room was annunciatory of an impending storm.

meanings.sent1: The clock's annunciatory chime reminded him of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The letter contained an annunciatory message about the upcoming event.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's chattering was annunciatory of an approaching storm.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds in the sky were annunciatory of rain.
meanings.sent5: The sudden drop in temperature was annunciatory of the changing seasons.
